title: Sons of Namatjira (A)
creator_credit: Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies and Curtis Levy
brief_description: Keith Namatjira and his relatives paint in the style of his father, Albert and live in an artist’s camp set up by his father on the outskirts of Alice Springs. Highlights problems which the Namatjiras and Aborigines in general have to confront in their relationship with the world outside the community.
